intro: Calcearia, commonly known as the "snowflake flower," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that resemble tiny snowflakes, often in shades of white or pale pink. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Calcearia species are native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. They thrive in well-drained soil and full sun, making them popular choices for rock gardens and containers.
